Option1: No difference, both make text bold.

What is the difference between block-level and inline-level elements in HTML?
Option1: Block-level elements can contain inline elements, but not vice-versa.
Option2: Block-level elements start on a new line and take up the full width available; inline-level elements do not start on a new line and only take up as much width as necessary.
Option3: Inline-level elements are for styling, block-level elements are for structure.
Option4: Block-level elements are deprecated, inline-level elements are preferred.
Answer: Block-level elements start on a new line and take up the full width available; inline-level elements do not start on a new line and only take up as much width as necessary.

What is semantic HTML?
Option1: HTML that is styled with CSS.
Option2: HTML that uses elements that convey meaning about the content they contain, improving accessibility and SEO.
Option3: HTML that is generated by JavaScript.
Option4: HTML that uses only modern tags.
Answer: HTML that uses elements that convey meaning about the content they contain, improving accessibility and SEO.

Question: Why is semantic HTML important?
Option1: It makes the website load faster.
Option2: It helps search engines understand the content, improves accessibility for screen readers, and makes code more readable and maintainable.
Option3: It is a requirement for all web browsers.
Option4: It automatically generates a table of contents.
Answer: It helps search engines understand the content, improves accessibility for screen readers, and makes code more readable and maintainable.
